definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
"fire" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 86), occurring in 熙, 然, 熊 etc
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: lit. to burn zithers and cook cranes/fig. to waste valuable resources/to destroy wantonly beautiful things
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
the cooked duck flew away (proverb)/(fig.) to let a sure thing slip through one's fingers
pinyin: zhu3 shu2 de5 ya1 zi5 fei1 le5

sentences.english: Well cook dumplings with seafood for you.
sentences.chinese: 我们煮海鲜水饺给你吃。

sentences.english: After pulling off the shell, she observed the hard-boiled egg inside.
sentences.chinese: 当女儿敲碎蛋壳发现里面已经是被煮得很硬的蛋白。

sentences.english: The table was set for lunch, and the coffee was boiling on the black iron stove.
sentences.chinese: 午餐桌已备好，黑铁炉上正煮着咖啡。

sentences.english: Controlling the heat is of great importance in making Laba porridge.
sentences.chinese: 煮腊八粥时控制好火候是关键。

sentences.english: Stir in the cream and reheat to serving temperature without boiling.
sentences.chinese: 搅拌奶油，不用煮加热到合适的温度。

sentences.english: Then you come home and cook up the legs for dinner because they are considered a delicacy.
sentences.chinese: 然后你回到家煮蛙腿当晚餐，因为它们是非常美味的。

sentences.english: Add tomato puree, salt and 1 cup water; bring to a boil.
sentences.chinese: 加入番茄酱，盐与1杯水，煮至沸腾。

sentences.english: He is so stupid that he can't boil an egg.
sentences.chinese: 他太笨了，连鸡蛋都不会煮。

sentences.english: This salesman demonstrated how to cook with a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 这个倾销员当众演示如何用压力锅煮东西。

sentences.english: Put the small balls into the boiling water until they become flowing.
sentences.chinese: 把搓好的小丸子放入滚水中煮滚及浮起。

sentences.english: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 2 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 加热至煮开，将火调小并继续煮2分钟。

sentences.english: If you're affluent, you can also put a lemon slice after discharge into the pot boil .
sentences.chinese: 如果你富裕，你也可以把锅后，煮到放电的柠檬片。

sentences.english: Too much times is being spent around the Mr.
sentences.chinese: 在电煮咖啡机旁花了太多的时间。

sentences.english: Potatoes and cauliflower tend to turn brown when boiling, especially when you're having company for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 土豆和花菜在水煮的时候容易变成咖啡色。

sentences.english: Cover and boil 3 to 5 minutes longer or until crisp-tender.
sentences.chinese: 再盖锅煮3到5分钟或更长直到变得清脆细嫩。

sentences.english: And the nutrition will also be lost if we use the iron or copper pan to cook the mushrooms.
sentences.chinese: 煮蘑菇时也不能用铁锅或铜锅，以免造成营养损失。

definition: to cook in a covered vessel/to casserole/to stew
to cook slowly over a low flame/pot/saucepan
(of food etc) soft/pulpy/(Tw) (of a person) lacking drive/shiftless/lazy
quick-boil/to boil for a short time
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
